analyzed: yāvatyaḥ tāsu gaṅgā nadīṣu vālukāḥ bhaveyuḥ tāvataḥ lokadhātūn kaścid eva strī vā puruṣaḥ vā sapta ratna paripurṇam kṛtvā tathāgatebhyaḥ hadbhayaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhebhyaḥ dānam dadyāt
translated: Suppose some woman or man were to fill with the seven precious substances as many world systems as there are sand-grains in the river Ganges, and give them away.

original: tat kiṃ manyase subhūteapi nu sā strī vā puruṣo vā tatonidānaṃ bahu puṇyaskandhaṃ prasunuyāt /

translated: Subhuti: A great deal, O Lord.

original: bahu sugata strī vā puruṣo vā tatonidānaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasunuyādaprameyamasaṃkhyeyam /🔽bhagavānāha yaśca khalu punaḥ subhūte strī vā puruṣo vā tāvato lokadhātūn saptaratnaparipūrṇaṃ kṛtvā tathāgatebhyo'rhadbhayaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhebhyo dānaṃ dadyāt /

translated: A great deal, O Sugata, that woman or man would generate a great deal of merit, immeasurable and incalculable.

original: yaśca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā ito dharmaparyāyādantaśaścatuṣpādikāmapi gāthāmudgṛhya parebhyo deśayet saṃprakāśayet /

translated: The Lord: But, Subhuti, a son or daughter of good family would generate much merit if he or she were to take up even one four-line verse from this Dharma discourse and expound it to others, and make it known.

analyzed: ayam eva tatonidānam bahutaram puṇya skandham prasunuyāt aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam
translated: He would generate a much greater, immeasurable, incalculable heap of merit from that cause.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhute yasmin pṛthivīpradeśe ito dharmaparyāyādantaśaścatuṣpādikāmapi gāthāmudgṛhya bhāṣyeta vā saṃprakāśyeta vā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhute yasmin pṛthivī pradeśe itas dharmaparyāyāt antaśas catuṣpādikām api gāthām udgṛhya bhāṣyeta vā saṃprakāśyeta vā
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in whatever place on earth a verse of four lines from this Dharma discourse would be recited, taught, or explained,

analyzed: sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ caitya bhūtaḥ bhavet sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya
translated: that place on earth would become a holy place for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: kaḥ punarvādo ye imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sakalasamāptaṃ dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye imam dharmaparyāyam sakala samāptam dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: What need is there to speak of those who will possess this Dharma discourse in its entirety, read it, master it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and extensively teach it to others?

original: parameṇa te subhūte āścaryeṇa samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: parameṇa te subhūte āścaryeṇa samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be endowed with the highest wonder, Subhūti.

original: tasmiṃśca subhūte pṛthivīpradeśe śāstā viharatyanyatarānyataro vā vijñagurusthānīyaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmin ca subhūte pṛthivī pradeśe śāstā viharati anyatara anyataraḥ vā vijña guru sthānīyaḥ
translated: And in that place on earth, the Teacher or some other wise and venerable person dwells.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatko nāma ayaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ nāma ayam bhagavan dharmaparyāyaḥ

analyzed: katham ca enam dhārayāmi

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ subhūtimetadavocat prajñāpāramitā nāmāyaṃ subhūte dharmaparyāyaḥ /

translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti, Subhuti, this Dharma discourse is called the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam ca enam dhāraya
translated: And you should remember it like this.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yā eva subhūte prajñāpāramitā tathāgatena bhāṣitā
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom that has been taught by the Tathagata

analyzed: sā eva apāramitā tathāgatena bhāṣitā
translated: is itself the perfection that has been taught by the Tathagata.

analyzed: tena ucyate prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūteapi nu asti sa kaściddharmo yastathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte api nu asti sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ

translated: Subhuti said, No, Blessed One.

analyzed: na asti sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ
translated: There is no dharma that has been taught by the Tathagata.

original: bhagavānāhatatkiṃ manyase subhūteyāvat trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau pṛthivīrajaḥ kaccit /🔽tadbahu bhavet /

analyzed: bahu sugata pṛthivī rajaḥ bhavet

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

translated: Blessed One, that dust on the earth that has been spoken of by the Tathagata🔽is not dust, Blessed One, it has been spoken of by the Tathagata as not dust.

analyzed: tena ucyate pṛthivī rajaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is called the dust of the earth.

analyzed: yaḥ pi asau lokadhātuḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ
translated: And that world system which is spoken of by the Tathagata,

translated: that is a non-system which is spoken of by the Tathagata.

analyzed: tena ucyate lokadhātuḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is called the world system.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase subhūte dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaistathāgato'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho draṣṭavyaḥ /

analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: Subhuti said, So it is, Blessed One.

analyzed: dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One should be seen by means of the thirty-two marks of a great being.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

translated: those are non-marks which are spoken of by the Tathagata.

analyzed: tena ucyante dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni iti
translated: Therefore, they are called the thirty-two marks of a great being.

translated: The Blessed One said, And again, Subhuti, if a woman or a man were to give up as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river every day,

translated: Thus, abandoning in this way, he would abandon those bodies for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

analyzed: yaḥ ca itas catuṣpādikām api gāthām udgṛhya parebhyaḥ deśayet saṃprakāśayet
translated: And whoever, from this Dharma discourse, would take up even just a four-line verse and teach it to others, explain it,

analyzed: ayam eva tatonidānam bahutaram puṇya skandham prasunuyāt aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam
translated: that one, on that basis, would produce a much greater heap of merit, immeasurable and incalculable.

translated: Then indeed the Venerable Subhūti, with the force of the Dharma, shed tears.

translated: He, wiping away the tears, said this to the Blessed One: It is wonderful, Blessed One.

analyzed: yatas me bhagavan jñānam utpannam

translated: Blessed One, I have never before heard such a Dharma discourse.

translated: But, Blessed One, those beings who, in the future time, in the future period, in the last five hundred years when the true Dharma is disappearing,

analyzed: tasmāt eva tathāgataḥ bhāṣate apratiṣṭhitena bodhisattvena dānam dātavyam
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata teaches that the Bodhisattva should give gifts without being established.

analyzed: na rūpa śabda gandha rasa sparśa dharma pratiṣṭhitena dānam dātavyam
translated: He should not give gifts established in form, sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte bodhisattvena evaṃrūpo dānaparityāgaḥ kartavyaḥ sarvasattvānāmarthāya /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte bodhisattvena evaṃrūpaḥ dāna parityāgaḥ kartavyaḥ sarva sattvānām arthāya
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva should make such a gift and renunciation for the sake of all beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yā ca eṣā subhūte sattva saṃjñā
translated: And what is this notion of beings, Subhuti,

analyzed: sā eva asaṃjñā
translated: That itself is non-perception.

original: ya evaṃ te sarvasattvāstathāgatena bhāṣitāsta eva asattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye evam te sarva sattvāḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitāḥ te eva asattvāḥ
translated: Those very beings who are spoken of by the Tathāgata as beings are indeed non-beings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: bhūta vādī subhūte tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, Subhūti, is a speaker of truth.

analyzed: satya vādī tathāvādī an anyathāvādī tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is a speaker of truth, a speaker of what is so, not a speaker of what is not so.

analyzed: na vitatha vādī tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is not a speaker of falsehood.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte yastathāgatena dharmo'bhisaṃbuddho deśito nidhyātaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte yaḥ tathāgatena dharmaḥ abhisaṃbuddhaḥ deśitaḥ nidhyātaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Dharma that is realized and taught by the Tathāgata,

analyzed: na tatra satyam na mṛṣā
translated: in that there is neither truth nor falsehood.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte puruṣo'ndhakārapraviṣṭo na kiṃcidapi paśyet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte puruṣaḥ undhakāra praviṣṭaḥ na kiṃcid api paśyet
translated: Just as, Subhūti, a man who has entered darkness would not see anything at all,

original: evaṃ vastupatito bodhisattvo draṣṭavyo yo vastupatito dānaṃ parityajati /
analyzed: evam vastu patitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ yaḥ vastu patitaḥ dānam parityajati
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva who has fallen into substantiality should be seen, who abandons generosity having fallen into substantiality.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte cakṣuṣmān puruṣaḥ prabhātāyāṃ rātrau sūrye'bhyudgate nānavidhāni rūpāṇi paśyet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte cakṣuṣmān puruṣaḥ prabhātāyām rātrau sūryebhyaḥ udgate nānavidhāni rūpāṇi paśyet
translated: Just as, Subhūti, a man with eyes, when the night has dawned and the sun has risen, would see various forms,

original: evamavastupatito bodhisattvo draṣṭavyo yo'vastupatito dānaṃ parityajati //
analyzed: evam avastu patitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ yaḥ vastu patitaḥ dānam parityajati
translated: in the same way, a bodhisattva who has not fallen into substantiality should be seen, who abandons generosity without having fallen into substantiality.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, a bodhisattva who has fallen into substantiality should be seen as like a man who has entered darkness, who does not see anything at all.🔽A bodhisattva who has not fallen into substantiality should be seen as like a man with eyes, when the night has dawned and the sun has risen, who sees various forms.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte ye kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā imaṃ dharmaparyāyamudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte ye kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā imam dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, those sons and daughters of good family who will take up this discourse on Dharma, will bear it in mind, recite it, master it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and explain it in detail to others,

analyzed: jñātāḥ te subhūte tathāgatena buddha jñānena
translated: they will be known, Subhuti, by the Tathagata through the knowledge of a Buddha.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ te subhūte tathāgatena buddha cakṣuṣā
translated: They will be seen, Subhuti, by the Tathagata through the eye of a Buddha.

analyzed: buddhāḥ te tathāgatena
translated: They will be recognized, Subhuti, by the Tathagata.

original: sarve te subhūte sattvā aprameyamasaṃkhyeyaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyanti pratigrahīṣyanti // //
analyzed: sarve te subhūte sattvāḥ aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam puṇya skandham prasaviṣyanti pratigrahīṣyanti
translated: All those beings, Subhuti, will produce an immeasurable, incalculable heap of merit, and will take it up.

original: yaśca khalu punaḥ subhūte strī vā puruṣo vā purvāhṇakālasamaye gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānātmabhāvān parityajet /🔽evaṃ madhyāhnakālasamaye gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānātmabhāvān parityajet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca khalu punar subhūte strī vā puruṣaḥ vā purvāhṇa kāla samaye gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāna ātmabhāvān parityajet  evam madhyāhna kāla samaye gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāna ātmabhāvān parityajet
translated: And again, Subhuti, if a woman or a man were to give up as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river at the time of dawn,🔽and likewise were to give up as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river at midday,

analyzed: sāyāhna kāla samaye gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāna ātmabhāvān parityajet
translated: and were to give up as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river at the time of dusk,

analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa bahūni kalpa koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi ātmabhāvān parityajet
translated: and were to give up in this way many bodies for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of kalpas,

analyzed: yaḥ ca imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā na pratikṣipet
translated: And whoever, having heard this Dharma discourse, does not reject it,

analyzed: ayam eva tatonidānam bahutaram puṇya skandham prasunuyāt aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam
translated: on that basis alone, he would generate a much greater heap of merit, immeasurable and incalculable.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ likhitvā udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet paryavāpnuyāt
translated: So what to speak of one who, having written it out, would take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet
translated: and explain it in detail to others?

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte acintyo'tulyo'yaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte acintya utulyaḥ yam dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, this Dharma discourse is inconceivable and incomparable.

original: ayaṃ ca subhūte dharmaparyāyastathāgatena bhāṣito'grayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ sattvānāmarthāya /
analyzed: ayam ca subhūte dharmaparyāyaḥ tathāgatena bhāṣita ugra yāna saṃprasthitānām sattvānām arthāya
translated: And, Subhūti, this Dharma discourse was spoken by the Tathāgata for the sake of beings who have set out in the supreme vehicle.

analyzed: śreṣṭha yāna saṃprasthitānām sattvānām arthāya
translated: For the sake of beings who have set out in the excellent vehicle.

original: ye imaṃ dharmaparyāyamudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: ye imam dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: Those who will take up this Dharma discourse, bear it in mind, recite it, study it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and explain it in detail to others.

analyzed: jñātāḥ te subhūte tathāgatena buddha jñānena
translated: They are known, Subhūti, by the Tathāgata with the knowledge of a Buddha.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ te subhūte tathāgatena buddha cakṣuṣā
translated: They are seen, Subhūti, by the Tathāgata with the eye of a Buddha.

analyzed: buddhāḥ te tathāgatena
translated: They are Buddhas, those beings are Tathāgatas.

original: sarve te subhūte sattvā aprameyeṇa puṇyaskandhenāṃ samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te subhūte sattvāḥ aprameyeṇa puṇya skandhena ām samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: All those beings, Subhuti, will be endowed with an immeasurable heap of merit.

analyzed: acintyena atulyena amāpyena aparimāṇena puṇya skandhena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be endowed with an inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, and unlimited heap of merit.

original: sarve te subhūte sattvāḥ samāṃśena bodhiṃ dhārayiṣyanti vacayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: sarve te subhūte sattvāḥ sama aṃśena bodhim dhārayiṣyanti vacayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: All those beings, Subhuti, will equally uphold, read, and master the enlightenment.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: na hi śakyaṃ subhūte ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo hīnādhimuktiakaiḥ sattvaiḥ śrotum /
analyzed: na hi śakyam subhūte ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ hīna adhimuktiakaiḥ sattvaiḥ śrotum
translated: Subhuti, it is not possible for beings of low aspiration to hear this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: na ātma dṛṣṭikaiḥ na sattva dṛṣṭikaiḥ na jīva dṛṣṭikaiḥ na pudgala dṛṣṭikaiḥ
translated: Not for those with the view of self, not for those with the view of sentient being, not for those with the view of living being, not for those with the view of person.

original: nābodhisattvapratijñai sattvaiḥ śakyamayaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ śrotuṃ vā udgrahītuṃ vā dhārayituṃ vā vācayituṃ vā paryavāptuṃ vā /
analyzed: na a bodhisattva pratijñaiḥ sattvaiḥ śakyam ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ śrotum vā udgrahītum vā dhārayitum vā vācayitum vā paryavāptum vā
translated: Not for beings who have not vowed to become bodhisattvas is it possible to hear, accept, uphold, read, or master this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: This is not possible.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte yatra pṛthivīpradeśe idaṃ sūtraṃ prakaśayiṣyate /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte yatra pṛthivī pradeśe idam sūtram prakaśayiṣyate
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, wherever this sutra will be revealed in that place,

original: pūjanīyaḥ sa pṛthivīpradeśo bhaviṣyati sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya /
analyzed: pūjanīyaḥ sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ bhaviṣyati sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya
translated: that place of earth will be worthy of worship for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

analyzed: vandanīyaḥ pradakṣiṇīyaḥ ca sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That place of earth will be worthy of worship and circumambulation.

original: caityabhūtaḥ sa pṛthivīpradeśo bhaviṣyati // //🔽api tu ye te subhūte kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā imānevaṃrūpān sūtrāntānudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: caitya bhūtaḥ sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ bhaviṣyati  api tu ye te subhūte kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: That place of earth will be like a caitya.🔽Moreover, those sons or daughters of good family, Subhūti, who will take up, bear in mind, recite, master,

analyzed: yoniśas ca manasi kariṣyanti
translated: and properly pay attention to sūtras of this kind,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and will explain them in detail to others,

analyzed: te paribhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: they will be despised.

analyzed: su paribhūtāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be very much despised.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yāni ca teṣāṃ subhūte sattvānāṃ paurvajanmikānyaśubhāni karmāṇi kṛtānyapāyasaṃvartanīyāni /
analyzed: yāni ca teṣām subhūte sattvānām paurvajanmikāni aśubhāni karmāṇi kṛtāni apāya saṃvartanīyāni
translated: And those actions that those beings, Subhūti, have previously done that are not good, that lead to bad rebirths,

original: dṛṣṭa eva dharme paribhūtatayā tāni paurvajanmikānyaśubhāni karmāṇi kṣapayiṣyanti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe eva dharme paribhūta tayā tāni paurvajanmikāni aśubhāni karmāṇi kṣapayiṣyanti
translated: by being despised in this very life, those previous not good actions will be exhausted.

analyzed: buddha bodhim ca anuprāpsyanti
translated: And they will attain the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: abhijānāmyahaṃ subhūte atīte'dhvanyasaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairasaṃkhyeyatarairdīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pareṇa paratareṇa caturaśītibuddhakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇyabhūvan ye mayārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: abhijānāmi aham subhūte atīta idhvani asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeyataraiḥ dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pareṇa paratareṇa caturaśīti buddha koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi abhūvan ye mayā ārāgitāḥ
translated: I remember, Subhuti, in the past, in a time gone by, incalculable, beyond measure, beyond reckoning, more than innumerable, more than uncountable aeons ago, there were eighty-four thousand koṭi-niyuta-hundred-thousands of Buddhas, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones, who were worshipped by me,

analyzed: ārāgya na virāgitāḥ
translated: and having worshipped them, I did not turn away from them.

original: yacca mayā subhūte te buddhā bhagavanta ārāgitāḥ /
analyzed: yat ca mayā subhūte te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ ārāgitāḥ
translated: And, Subhuti, those Buddhas, the Lords, who were worshipped by me,

analyzed: ārāgya na virāgitāḥ
translated: and having worshipped them, I did not turn away from them.

original: yacca paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāṃ saddharmavipralopakāle vartamāne imānevaṃrūpān sūtrāntānudgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: yat ca paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām saddharma vipralopa kāle vartamāne imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: And in the later times, in the later times of the last five hundred years of the Dharma, when the true Dharma is being destroyed, they will take up, bear in mind, read, master, and expound to others such Sutras as these.

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: And they will expound them in detail to others.

original: asya khalu punaḥ subhūte puṇyaskandhasyāntikādasau paurvakaḥ puṇyaskandhaḥ śatatamīmapi kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: asya khalu punar subhūte puṇya skandhasya antikāt asau paurvakaḥ puṇya skandhaḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: Compared to this heap of merit, that former heap of merit does not amount even to a hundredth part,

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭimamipi koṭiśatatamīmapi koṭiśatasahasratamīmapi koṭiniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭim amipi koṭi śatatamīm api koṭi śata sahasratamīm api koṭi niyuta śata sahasratamīm api
translated: up to a thousandth part, up to a hundred thousandth part, up to a koṭi-hundred-thousandth part, up to a koṭi-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousandth part, up to a koṭi-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousand-hundred-thousandth part,

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi upaniṣadamapi yāvadaupamyamapi na kṣamate //
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api upaniṣadam api yāvat aupamyam api na kṣamate
translated: it cannot bear comparison, cannot bear calculation, cannot bear reckoning, cannot bear analogy, up to cannot bear similarity.

original: sacetpunaḥ subhūte teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ vā ahaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ bhāṣeyam /
analyzed: saced punar subhūte teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām vā aham puṇya skandham bhāṣeyam
translated: If, Subhūti, I were to teach the mass of merit of those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family,

original: yāvatte kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā tasmin samaye puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yāvat te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā tasmin samaye puṇya skandham prasaviṣyanti
translated: to that extent those sons of a good family and those daughters of a good family would generate the mass of merit at that time.

analyzed: pratigrahīṣyanti
translated: They would receive it.

analyzed: unmādam sattvāḥ anuprāpnuyuḥ citta vikṣepam vā gaccheyuḥ
translated: Beings would attain madness or go to mental disturbance.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ subhūte acintyo'tulyo'yaṃ dharmaparyāyastathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar subhūte acintya utulyaḥ yam dharmaparyāyaḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitaḥ
translated: But, Subhūti, this Dharma discourse has been taught by the Tathāgata as inconceivable and incomparable.

analyzed: asya acintyaḥ eva vipākaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: The inconceivable alone should be expected as its result.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocatkathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitena sthātavyam /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katham bhagavan bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitena sthātavyam
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, how should one who has set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas stand?

analyzed: katham pratipattavyam
translated: How should one practice?

analyzed: katham cittam pragrahītavyam
translated: How should the mind be focused?

original: bhagavānāhaiha subhūte bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitena evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyamsarve sattvā mayā anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvāpayitavyāḥ
analyzed: bhagavān āha eha subhūte bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitena evam cittam utpādayitavyam sarve sattvāḥ mayā an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvāpayitavyāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, one who has set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas should arouse the mind in this way: 'All beings should be led to nirvana by me in the realm of nirvana without remainder.'

original: evaṃ sa sattvān parinirvāpya na kaścitsattvaḥ parinirvāpito bhavati /
analyzed: evam sa sattvān parinirvāpya na kaścid sattvaḥ parinirvāpitaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, having led beings to nirvana, no being at all has been led to nirvana.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: saced subhūte bodhisattvasya sattva saṃjñā pravarteta
translated: Subhūti, if the notion of beings were to occur to a bodhisattva,

analyzed: na sa bodhisattvaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: he should not be called a bodhisattva.

analyzed: jīva saṃjñā vā yāvat pudgala saṃjñā vā pravarteta
translated: If the notion of a living being, up to the notion of a person were to occur,

analyzed: na sa bodhisattvaḥ iti vaktavyaḥ
translated: he should not be called a bodhisattva.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: nāsti subhūte sa kaściddharmo yo bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthito nāma //
analyzed: na asti subhūte sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitaḥ nāma
translated: Subhūti, there is no dharma whatsoever that is called one who has set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: tatkiṃ manyase subhūte asti sa kaściddharmo yastathāgatena dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasyāntikādanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase subhūte asti sa kaścid dharmaḥ yaḥ tathāgatena dīpaṃkarasya tathāgatasya antikāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Subhūti, what do you think, is there any dharma whatsoever that the Tathāgata realized as supreme perfect enlightenment in the presence of the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara?

original: evamukte āyuṣmān subhūtirbhagavantametadavocat yathāhaṃ bhagavato bhāṣitasyārthamājānāmi /
